citeinfo.origin: National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA), Hazardous Materials Response Assessment Division
citeinfo.title: Cameo, Valdez

descript.abstract: Data Type: Exxon Valdez Oil Spill; The Computer Aided Management of Emergency Operations (CAMEO) Valdez (CV89) was designed to track the progress of Exxon's shoreline treatment operations and forecast progress based on recent performance.. It includes four databases: CV89, CV90, CV91 and Segment Summary database. CV90 and CV91 were used to track data during the assessment, treatment, and demobilization phases of cleanup in 1990 and 1991 respectively. the segment Summary database is a compilation of three year's worth of data accumulated from the Exxon Valdez incident with an emphasis on cleanup methods.

idinfo.accconst: No access restrictions, requires hypercard 2.0 or higher on a 2MB MacIntosh Plus or higher.
idinfo.useconst: Anyone wishing to use all or part of the data for purposes other than tracking the cleanup process of the EVOS should consult with NOAA HAZMAT to ensure accurate interpretation of data.

distinfo.distliab: While every effort has been made to ensure that these data are accurate and reliable within the limits of the current state of the art, NOAA cannot assume liability for any damages caused by any errors or omissions in the data, nor as a result of the failure of the data to function on a particular system. NOAA makes no warranty, expressed or implied, nor does the fact of distribution constitute such a warranty.

cntaddr.address: NOAA / AFSC / PMEL, 7600 Sand Point Way N.E.

metainfo.metstdn: Content Standards for Digital Geospatial Metadata
